block.p: WEYERHAEUSER CO., Federal Way, Wash., a maker of pulp used to make paper, said it would buy back up to 10 million more common shares, or about 4.3 percent of its stock outstanding, over the next year after just completing a stock repurchase program of 12 million shares.

AMERISOURCE HEALTH CORP., Malvern, Pa., the fourth-largest drug wholesaler in the United States, won a five-year supply agreement valued at more than $1 billion from Medicap Pharmacies Inc., Des Moines, an owner and franchiser of almost 200 pharmacies in 37 states.

WEYERHAEUSER CO., Federal Way, Wash., a maker of pulp used to make paper, said it would buy back up to 10 million more common shares, or about 4.3 percent of its stock outstanding, over the next year after just completing a stock repurchase program of 12 million shares.

AMERISOURCE HEALTH CORP., Malvern, Pa., the fourth-largest drug wholesaler in the United States, won a five-year supply agreement valued at more than $1 billion from Medicap Pharmacies Inc., Des Moines, an owner and franchiser of almost 200 pharmacies in 37 states.
AMERICAN GREETINGS CORP., Cleveland, agreed to buy CPS Corp., Franklin, Tenn., a gift wrap and decorative-packaging company owned by the Fox Valley Corp., Appleton, Wis., for an undisclosed price.

BOSTON PRIVATE FINANCIAL HOLDINGS INC., Boston, a financial holding and banking and investment services company, bought Sand Hill Advisors Inc., Menlo Park, Calif., an investment company, for about $11.2 million in cash and $4.8 million in stock.
